DOC.detailed_description: The objective pilot research investigate effect two behavioral smoke cessation program aspects cue-induced cigarette craving , investigate neural base effect . The specific objective study include 1 ) investigate effect behavioral therapy cue induce crave use cognitive task fMRI paradigm 2 ) pilot test questionnaire study procedure , 3 ) gather preliminary estimate effect size novel behavioral therapy smoking cessation order inform design large trial . A secondary goal research 1 ) determine impact two cognitive cop technique attentional bias smoke related cue measure behavioral response pattern neural activation 2 ) determine impact two cognitive cop technique cue-induced cigarette crave measure self-report pattern neural activation . Daily smoker desire quit smoking randomize one two behavioral smoke cessation program : ( 1 ) standard cognitive behavioral therapy ( 2 ) mindfulness-based cognitive therapy . Participants complete questionnaire brief computer-based cognitive testing paradigm . Participants also underwent fMRI scan quit day ( week 5 ) . A randomly assign subset participant ( n= 18 ) , underwent two additional scan baseline ( week 1 ) end-of-therapy ( week 8 ) . The study thus use self-report measure , cognitive testing ( Stroop task ) , fMRI ( functional magnetic resonance imaging ) assessment .
